summary: Microsoft reported a solid start to its fiscal year 2025, with total revenue reaching $65.6 billion, a 16% increase year-over-year, and earnings per share of $3.30, up 10%. The growth was primarily driven by the strength of Microsoft Cloud, which generated $38.9 billion in revenue, reflecting a 22% increase. The company emphasized its strategic focus on cloud services and AI infrastructure, noting a significant increase in long-term commitments and contracts, particularly in Azure and Microsoft 365. Market conditions remain favorable, with strong demand for cloud services, although the company acknowledged potential volatility in bookings due to the unpredictable nature of larger contracts. Notable updates included the integration of Activision, which contributed to revenue growth but also impacted operating income. Challenges mentioned included the need for substantial capital expenditures to support AI scaling ambitions and the environmental sustainability of new data centers. Overall, Microsoft remains optimistic about its growth trajectory, despite the risks associated with market fluctuations and operational constraints.
key_highlights: Microsoft Cloud revenue reached $38.9 billion, growing 22% year-over-year.
Total revenue for the quarter was $65.6 billion, a 16% increase, with earnings per share at $3.30.
Commercial bookings increased by 30%, driven by strong demand for long-term commitments to the Microsoft Cloud platform.
The integration of Activision contributed approximately 3 points to revenue growth but had a negative impact on operating income.
Microsoft faces challenges related to capital expenditures for AI infrastructure and the need for environmentally sustainable data center operations.

metrics.metric_name: AI Business Annual Revenue Run Rate

kpis.name: Azure Growth
kpis.context: Azure and other cloud services revenue grew 33% and 34% in constant currency.

kpis.name: Intelligent Cloud Revenue
kpis.context: Intelligent Cloud segment revenue was $24.1 billion, increasing 20% and 21% in constant currency.

kpis.name: M365 Commercial Cloud Revenue Growth
kpis.context: M365 commercial cloud revenue increased 15% and 16% in constant currency.

kpis.name: LinkedIn Revenue Growth
kpis.context: LinkedIn revenue increased 10% and 9% in constant currency.

kpis.name: Dynamics 365 Revenue Growth
kpis.context: Dynamics revenue grew 14%, driven by Dynamics 365, which grew 18% and 19% in constant currency.

kpis.name: M365 Consumer Cloud Revenue Growth
kpis.context: M365 consumer cloud revenue growth should be in the mid-single digits driven by M365 subscriptions.

kpis.name: Commercial Remaining Performance Obligation
kpis.context: Commercial remaining performance obligation increased 22% and 21% in constant currency to $259 billion.

kpis.name: Operating Margins
kpis.context: Operating margins were 47%, down 1 point year-over-year.

kpis.name: Paid M365 Commercial Seats Growth
kpis.context: Paid M365 commercial seats grew 8% year-over-year.

kpis.name: AI Business Revenue Run Rate
kpis.context: AI business is on track to surpass an annual revenue run rate of $10 billion next quarter.

risk_factors.description: Fluctuations in market conditions could adversely affect revenue and profitability.
Changes in foreign currency exchange rates may impact total revenue and segment level revenue growth.
The need to scale AI infrastructure may affect gross margin percentages and overall profitability.
The expected losses from the investment in OpenAI could negatively impact other income and overall financial performance.
Delays or pushouts in supply could impact revenue recognition and growth rates.
Changes in regulations or compliance requirements could affect operational capabilities and financial results.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Launched new design system for knowledge work, improved response speed and quality.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Daily usage of Microsoft 365 more than doubled quarter-over-quarter.

strategic_initiatives.progress: AI business on track to surpass an annual revenue run rate of $10 billion next quarter.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Changing workflows across every role and business process.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Azure took share this quarter with over 39,000 customers using Azure Arc.
Dynamics 365 continues to take share with increased monthly active users of Copilot.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Fundamental change in the business applications market.

strategic_initiatives.progress: DAX Copilot documenting over 1.3 million physician patient encounters monthly.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Faster revenue growth than GitHub Copilot in its first year.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Continued collaboration leading to product innovations like GitHub Copilot and DAX Copilot.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Significant growth in value and differentiated IP.
